revised_title: Chemical Analysis of Dead Sea and River Jordan Waters
tldr: The author analyzes the waters of the Dead Sea and the River Jordan, discovering their unique mineral composition and explaining their intense salinity. The Dead Sea's water is found to contain muriat of lime, muriat of magnesia, and common salt, while the River Jordan's water has similar ingredients but in different proportions. The author's findings help to understand the unique properties of these water bodies and their historical significance.
